intro: Gagnepainia godefroyi, commonly known as the Godefroy's gynandropsis, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant has a compact growth habit with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of the island's rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered.
